title: Introduction to FastBreakR
text: Speed Efficiency: Optimized process large data requests rapidly, FastBreakR includes built-mechanisms like rate-limiting pauses ensure smooth operation adhering NBA API constraints. Data Consolidation: Seamlessly merges multiple statistical categories single, unified dataset automatically eliminating duplicate columns, ensuring cleaner organized output analysis. Consistent Tidy Naming: Column names cleaned standardized staying consistent NBA naming conventions. User-Friendly Design: Functions intuitive, making easy fetch manipulate data.

title: Introduction to FastBreakR
text: FastBreakR provides tools fetch everything play--play data advanced player stats. modular design ensures can fit analysis pipeline, whether ’re building predictive models, exploring shot tendencies, analyzing team lineups. vignette introduces primary functions FastBreakR, demonstrating capabilities providing examples help get started.

title: Introduction to FastBreakR
text: start, ensure installed FastBreakR package dependencies. can install FastBreakR directly GitHub:
code: # Install from GitHub  # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("JesseKartes/FastBreakR") install.packages("dplyr")

title: Introduction to FastBreakR
text: get started FastBreakR, simply load package along dplyr streamline data analysis workflow:
code: # Load the FastBreakR package library(FastBreakR) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)

title: Introduction to FastBreakR
text: nba_team_stats() function fetches NBA team statistics specified seasons. default, retrieves data following measure types, automatically removing duplicate columns merged categories: Traditional Stats Advanced Stats Four Factors Miscellaneous Stats Scoring Stats need one specific stat categories, simply use measure_type argument within nba_team_stats() function.

title: Introduction to FastBreakR
text: Now data frame team-level stats, let’s dive deeper retrieve box scores Christmas Day games 2023. Using team_stats data frame, can filter extract game IDs need. nba_box_scores() function fetches detailed box score data specified games stat categories. resulting data frame clean consolidated, duplicate columns across stat categories automatically removed easier analysis. Nice! Now data frame containing traditional stats, along detailed scoring stats mid-range points points turnovers. Additionally, ’ve incorporated hustle stats like deflections charges drawn, giving us comprehensive view game’s performance. enriched dataset allows deeper insights team player contributions across different aspects game.

what: Fetching Play-by-Play Data with Rate Limiting
title: Introduction to FastBreakR
text: Fetching play--play data NBA can resource-intensive, especially requesting data many games quick succession. ensure requests don’t result timeouts errors due rate limiting, FastBreakR incorporates automatic rate-limiting mechanism. example fetch play--play data specific set games, using nba_play_by_play() function. example demonstrates fetch data list game IDs. Let’s get play--play data set game IDs. Great! Now ’ve got raw play--play data small subset games. data ready analyzed visualized . Stay tuned—new functions developed make tasks even easier, simplifying process enhancing ability derive insights data!

title: Play-by-Play Analysis with FastBreakR
text: vignette demonstrates use FastBreakR’s play--play (pbp) functions generate lineups, lineup box scores, matchup box scores, player box scores.

title: Play-by-Play Analysis with FastBreakR
code: library(FastBreakR) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  df <- FastBreakR::nba_scores(2025) %>%   filter(game_id == "0022400408") Fetching season 2025 (1/1)  pbp <- nba_play_by_play(game_ids = unique(df$game_id)) Fetching 1 games in 1 batches Fetching batch 1/1: games 0022400408 to 0022400408

title: Play-by-Play Analysis with FastBreakR
text: First rows processed pbp
code: pbp_processed <- pbp_lineups(pbp) knitr::kable(head(pbp_processed), caption = 'First rows of processed pbp')

title: Play-by-Play Analysis with FastBreakR
text: Lineup box scores
code: lineup_bs <- pbp_box_scores_lineup(pbp_processed) knitr::kable(head(lineup_bs), caption = 'Lineup box scores')

title: Play-by-Play Analysis with FastBreakR
text: Lineup matchup box scores
code: matchup_bs <- FastBreakR::pbp_box_scores_lineup_matchups(pbp_processed) knitr::kable(head(matchup_bs), caption = 'Lineup matchup box scores')
